description: This file defines the HomeFragment class for an Android application, responsible for rendering a home screen with horizontally scrollable rows of video categories, including special rows like Continue Watching and Favorites. It manages focus navigation across rows and items, handles user input via DPAD for TV remotes, maintains state related to video progress and favorites, and interacts with the data layer and UI adapters to display content.

classes.name: HomeFragment
classes.description: A Fragment representing the home screen in the app, showing categorized rows of videos with focus and navigation management, handling user interactions, and updating UI dynamically based on data states.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment layout from XML.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Initializes data stores, sets up RecyclerView, defines key event handling for DPAD navigation, and starts collecting updates for favorites.

methods.name: onResume
methods.description: Refreshes UI data when returning to the fragment.

methods.name: refreshRows
methods.description: Updates UI rows based on current data, rebuilds focus management, and restores focus state.

methods.name: resolveFavorites
methods.description: Converts set of favorite IDs into a list of Video objects, maintaining order.

methods.name: getVideosForRow
methods.description: Returns the list of videos for a specified row index.

methods.name: getSelectedVideo
methods.description: Fetches a video based on row and column indices.

methods.name: isContinueWatchingRow
methods.description: Checks if a given row index corresponds to the Continue Watching row.

methods.name: getRowKey
methods.description: Returns a unique row key string based on the category label.
